findings.title: Gas Blocking Risk
findings.description: Malicious attackers might exploit this to repeatedly add invalid contributors to a pool, potentially leading to a DOS attack.

findings.title: Unreasonable Slippage Setting
findings.description: In the Callbacks contract, the _openTradeMarketCallback function, when handling slippage for market orders, only considers slippage during position addition and does not take into account slippage evaluation for position reduction.

findings.title: Fees Lack Approval
findings.description: In the PoolRouter contract, the _executeLiquidity function does not check the approval value of the sender for the PoolRouter contract when liqFee is present, leading to potential callback failures.

findings.title: Incorrect Parameter Usage
findings.description: In the getUnrealizedPNL function, when the isLong parameter is true, it returns data for long positions, and when it's false, it returns data for short positions. However, in the _lpUnpnl function, the parameters were passed incorrectly, with the long parameter being passed as false and the short parameter being passed as true.

findings.title: DOS attack due to gas blocking
findings.description: Malicious attackers might exploit this to repeatedly add invalid contributors to a pool, potentially leading to a DOS attack.
